org.simplecorporation.myengine.core.image

Class Image

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.simplecorporation.myengine.core.image.Image

  • public class Image
extends java.lang.Object
    The Image class can load and store an image for use on PC and android.

    An Image can be used by BasicRenderer to render it to the screen

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private android.graphics.Bitmap androidImage
      An instance of the image used on Android without OpenGL (Android Bitmap)
      private java.awt.Image javaImage
      An instance of the image used on PC without OpenGL
      private org.newdawn.slick.opengl.Texture openGLImage
      An instance of the image used on PC with OpenGL (Texture from Slick2D)

    • Constructor Summary

      The constructor which will load the image automatically.

      The constructor which will load the image automatically.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Image

        public Image()
        The default constructor for Image It doesn't do anything. In order to load an image you must use load(String filePath , String format , boolean inFolder) unless you are developing for android, in which case, you should use load(int id)

      • Image

        public Image(java.lang.String filePath,
     java.lang.String format,
     boolean inFolder)
        The constructor which will load the image automatically. This constructor should only be used when loading an image on a PC
        Parameters:
        filePath - This is a string representing the path to the image file, this includes its extension
        format - This is a string representing the format of the image file e.g. PNG
        inFolder - This is a boolean value that states whether the image file is in a folder. If it is false, it will be assumed to be inside a .jar, or in the same path as the main class
        See Also:
        load(String filePath , String format , boolean inFolder)

      • Image

        public Image(int id)
        The constructor which will load the image automatically. This constructor should on be used when loading an image on Android
        Parameters:
        id - This is an integer value that is used to locate the image on Android. e.g. R.drawable.myimage
        See Also:
        load(int id)

    • Method Detail

      • load

        public void load(java.lang.String filePath,
        java.lang.String format,
        boolean inFolder)
        This method is used to load an image on a PC.
        Parameters:
        filePath - This is a string representing the path to the image file, this includes its extension
        format - This is a string representing the format of the image file e.g. PNG
        inFolder - This is a boolean value that states whether the image file is in a folder. If it is false, it will be assumed to be inside a .jar, or in the same path as the main class

      • load

        public void load(int id)
        This method is used to load an image on Android.
        Parameters:
        id - This is an integer value that is used to locate the image on Android. e.g. R.drawable.myimage

      • getURL

        public java.net.URL getURL(java.lang.String filePath)
        This method is used to turn a string into a URL, it is used when loading an image.
        Parameters:
        filePath - This is a string representing the path to the image file, this includes its extension
        Returns:
        This method return a URL, created using the String

      • getURLInputStream

        public java.io.InputStream getURLInputStream(java.lang.String filePath)
        The method used to get an InputStream using a certain file path
        Parameters:
        filePath - This is a string that is used to create the InputStream
        Returns:
        The input stream created using the file path
